subject: Disable zypper snapper plugin
commitMessage:
Disable zypper snapper plugin

snapper daemon isn't properly configured so disable zypper snapper
commit plugin until then.

Change-Id: I5a9a185f55fbd3af7a068403b135c0b42c484592
Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>

subject: Add support for X/Y/Z-modem protocols to the Base System
commitMessage:
Add support for X/Y/Z-modem protocols to the Base System

X/Y/Z-modem are protocols for file transfer over serial links.  They can
be used to send files to and receive them from a device with a serial
line (e.g. console) as the only communication channel.

Change-Id: I3cc5b1ad886fbacecba192926c2b46f46fcd4e89
Signed-off-by: ≈Åukasz Stelmach <l.stelmach@samsung.com>

Verified: lrzsz works properly on a target device. I am not able to verify how this change propagates to *-group.xml.gz file in the repository.
Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased

Patch Set 3: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

Verified === successfully built the package and lrzsz works on the image.
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

As others I would have add a reference to related jira bug ...

Patch Set 3:

There isn't any. Do we need one?

Patch Set 3:

Well, I could live without one, but it would help to track the context for the integration team and have a place to discuss on possible choices ... 

gerrit is a place for too but harder to search in... 

So that's why I'm inviting pple to create and cross link using DEP3's tags ...

Hope this help


Here is my proposal :
https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Talk:Packaging/Guidelines

Feel free to use that page to comment workflow

subject: remove uninstallable gcc-fortan
commitMessage:
remove uninstallable gcc-fortan

When adding @development group to make an image, mic complains that
 "uninstallable package, gcc-fortan"
In fact it's not used, and fortan is not provided.

Change-Id: Ic389a4ca143cdf9a536a5d06c430f04991ad30c8
Signed-off-by: Juan Zhao <juan.j.zhao@intel.com>

subject: add the base packages to meta-common
commitMessage:
add the base packages to meta-common

The following packages are both added in meta-ivi and meta-mobile, and they can
 be shared directly to meta-common, as they are the common base packages:

minizip		platform/upstream/zlib
		add to @console-tools in meta-common
net-tools	platform/upstream/net-tools
		add to @console-tools in meta-common

Change-Id: I0ecb6037610a0951c785771bc793fea274f579c7
Signed-off-by: Juan Zhao <juan.j.zhao@intel.com>

subject: PTREL-601: init graphics-ui-framework-x group
commitMessage:
PTREL-601: init graphics-ui-framework-x group

As xorg is used by many platforms like tizen mobile and generic.
We can refine the package group to add those xorg related packages.

So far this package list is generated from meta-mobile.

Change-Id: Idcaa624bac9c04b42f729c65fbb718ddf9017202
Signed-off-by: Juan Zhao <juan.j.zhao@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

I'd propose you name the pattern according to domains, e.g.,

Description: Graphics and UI Framework X
Name: graphics-ui-framework-x

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I can +2/merge if noone does

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The naming is not suitable.

- usually, adaptation refers to HW adaptation. 
- also, some of the packages cannot be found in Tizen:IVI. Therefore, it's not good to have such packages in 'common'.
Uploaded patch set 2.
Uploaded patch set 3.
Uploaded patch set 4.
Patch Set 4: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 4:

it's a good suggestion to refine the name.
mikko, it will be used for tizen:mobile and tizen:generic. And IVI, lite won't use this group. 

But it will bring the benefit to move Xorg packages out out the general framework group for wayland projects. And also it's a better to align all the X packages together in common, for the projects with Xorg.

subject: base pattern: add default-ac-domains
commitMessage:
base pattern: add default-ac-domains

The default-ac-domains package defines the default set of Tizen 3.0
Smack domains to use in RPM package manifests, so this package should be
installed in 3.0 images alongside the security-plugin.

Change-Id: I9211f21023dcb5ed3cf9e087cc0fa8fa789c8545
Signed-off-by: Patrick McCarty <patrick.mccarty@linux.intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:Mobile: 

 repository     arch           result         

 atom           i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI:Release: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

I verified locally by adding this package to an IVI 3.0 .ks file, building the IVI image, and examining the contents of /etc/smack/accesses.d/default-ac-domains, which contains 17 Smack rules.

There is an open issue to get this working on the infrastructure.  See https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/TIVI-2131
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Base System: Move packages to better locations
commitMessage:
Base System: Move packages to better locations

corewatcher and IP utilities suit better under development.

snapper plugin needs zypper so only add it with zypper itself. Also,
console-tools is a better home for certificates (for libssl) and
curl.

Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>
